html: The doctor who operated on #TreeofLife shooter is a Jew. The shooter shouted anti-Semitic slurs at him even as he tended his wounds. The doctor said that he was proud to offer medical care to a human who was wounded. You want to know what it means to be a Jew? Here's your answer.

html: Desperately sad news. The wonderful Michael Freedland, who was as inspiring a man as he was a writer and broadcaster, died suddenly yesterday. I was thrilled to bring him back into @JewishChron when I became editor. Typically, he filed a piece for next week early and perfectly.

text:
Love Actually director and @comicrelief co-founder Richard Curtis believes in the power of education.

He spoke to us at the launch of our new #UKaid and @BritishCouncil programme that will connect UK pupils with classrooms around the world.

html: In the past 2 years alone, there have been over 1,200 attacks on hospitals, ambulances and medical personnel – in just 16 countries. That’s an average of 50 attacks every month. That’s more than 11 attacks every week. That’s more 1 attack every day. Enough. #NotATargetpic.twitter.com/ObvcIwpgkl
text:
In the past 2 years alone, there have been over 1,200 attacks on hospitals, ambulances and medical personnel – in just 16 countries.

That’s an average of 50 attacks every month.

That’s more than 11 attacks every week.

That’s more 1 attack every day.

Enough.

#NotATargetpic.twitter.com/ObvcIwpgkl

html: First visit to Paris as Foreign Sec. There are no closer friends on our continent than UK and France. Entente Cordiale will thrive but EU states and above all the Commission must understand we need to work together to avoid a “no deal Brexit by accident” - it takes two to tango.
text: First visit to Paris as Foreign Sec. There are no closer friends on our continent than UK and France. Entente Cordiale will thrive but EU states and above all the Commission must understand we need to work together to avoid a “no deal Brexit by accident” - it takes two to tango.

html: I condemn the appalling attack in Adam. There is never an excuse for terror. My thoughts are with the family and friends of the victims, and I wish a full recovery to the injured. This tragic incident reinforces the need for all parties to work together for peace and stability.
text: I condemn the appalling attack in Adam. There is never an excuse for terror. My thoughts are with the family and friends of the victims, and I wish a full recovery to the injured. This tragic incident reinforces the need for all parties to work together for peace and stability.

html: We want to see a world where people with disabilities have equal access to jobs and education. That's why on 23-24 July, the UK is hosting a global #DisabilitySummit. We believe #NowIsTheTime to break down the barriers that hold people back from achieving their potential.pic.twitter.com/wDO8MeQvnZ
text:
We want to see a world where people with disabilities have equal access to jobs and education.

html: Pleased to meet Yemeni Foreign Minister, Khaled al-Yamani, in Riyadh. We discussed the impact of the conflict on ordinary Yemenis, who have a right to legitimate governance. We committed to work together with the UN Special Envoy @OSE_Yemen to achieve a political solution.pic.twitter.com/1aBkWj9Jgr
text: Pleased to meet Yemeni Foreign Minister, Khaled al-Yamani, in Riyadh. We discussed the impact of the conflict on ordinary Yemenis, who have a right to legitimate governance. We committed to work together with the UN Special Envoy @OSE_Yemen to achieve a political solution.pic.twitter.com/1aBkWj9Jgr

html: Productive meeting with Foreign Minister al-Jubeir and Undersecretary Mirdad of Saudi Arabia @KSAmofaEN. We discussed regional issues, including the situation in Yemen. We agreed that we must find a political solution to the crisis. @UKinSaudiArabiapic.twitter.com/XnGqYfrPat

html: Worrying escalation of violence in southern Israel and Gaza this weekend. We urge restraint from all sides, and appreciate UN and Egyptian efforts to reduce tensions. The people of Israel and Gaza deserve peace and security.
text: Worrying escalation of violence in southern Israel and Gaza this weekend. We urge restraint from all sides, and appreciate UN and Egyptian efforts to reduce tensions. The people of Israel and Gaza deserve peace and security.

html: Very disappointed to hear of demolitions in East Jerusalem village of Abu Nuwar yesterday, displacing dozens, including children. The UK condemns this action and calls on Israel to halt these demolitions, which cause unnecessary suffering and hamper prospects for peace.
text: Very disappointed to hear of demolitions in East Jerusalem village of Abu Nuwar yesterday, displacing dozens, including children. The UK condemns this action and calls on Israel to halt these demolitions, which cause unnecessary suffering and hamper prospects for peace.

html: On the 74th anniversary of the Normandy landings by Allied troops, we remember the crucial role the Tunisia Campaign played in providing a secure platform for the eventual victory of Allied Forces in Europe as well as the sacrifice of all concerned. #OperationTorch75th #DDaypic.twitter.com/HQ7rmphdZc

html: Are you bored in the summer months with no football to go to? Then join your local Non-League football club as a volunteer. There are plenty of jobs to do at this time of year - painting, mending, working on the pitch etc. You will get great satisfaction from helping out.

html: One year into the Gulf dispute, the UK urges all Gulf states to engage with Kuwaiti mediation, to find a way towards a resolution, and to ease the impact on the everyday lives of the people in the region.
